course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Environmental Science Fundamentals
course.description: Understanding our environment, including the ecology, biodiversity and cycles of environmental ecosystems, human environmental impacts such as climate change, energy use, chemical toxicology, waste disposal, water and air pollution; conservation; exploration of new green technologies to reduce impacts, environmental law and changes in policies to ensure sustainability. Case studies through group projects.

reviews.author: The Real Nathan
reviews.comment_content: It talks about a lot of environmental issue, mostly environmental science related. You will fall asleep if you are not interested in such area. There aren't much content to study for the finals, mostly take you like 4 to 5 days.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style is interesting and interactive. We did one experiments in class, we talked a lot of environmental news which inevitably will be used in final, but it is not he most important things you have to study in final. He will mention a lot of stuffs hat is not in the teaching powerpoint, so REMEMBER to take notes or ask friend for help.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is ok, better than other courses. I got mean in project and 15 ish points higher than mean in finals, also I only miss 1 or 2 lectures, I got a B+. The professor recognize all the faces in class, so you might want to be active in class and attend as much as you can, though there are no attendence.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload I would say its adequate, around 5 newspaper cutting, 1 assignments which one take you more than an hour to finish, and they are pretty important too. Materials for final isn't that much personally if you have already paid attention in class. Last the project, which is a presentation on an environmental issue which is related to us, it takes the most of the time but personally (our group ) is pretty chill so no stress.

reviews.author: gisquare
reviews.title: Nice and basic course for learning environmental science
reviews.comment_content:
Some of the contents are similar to dse biology and geology.
Chapter 1: Introduction to Environmental Science
Chapter 2: Ecological Footprint
Chapter 3: Environmental System
Chapter 4: Evolution, Biodiversity and Population Ecology
Chapter 5: Species Interactions and Comunity Ecology
Chapter 6: Biodiversity and Conservation Biology
Chapter 7: Human Population
Chapter 8: Agriculture
Chapter 9: Atmospheric Science
Chapter 10: Freshwater, oceans and coast
reviews.comment_teaching:
Arthur explained every concept clearly and provide many examples.
There are many supplementary slides for each lesson. Better to attain all the classes to get a comprehensive ideas on the course.
reviews.comment_grading: You can get a good grade if you pay attention to the lessons.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low Workload.

Only a few easy assignments.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
Environmental Issues
- Population (Ch. 6)
- Food (Ch. 7)
- Biodiversity and Conservation (Ch. 8)
- Environmental Health and Toxicology (Ch. 10)
- Water Resource and Pollution (Ch. 12)
- Air Pollution (Ch. 13)
- Waste Management Overview (Ch. 17)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Powerpoint so loose: cant find the mainpoint
but interactive teaching
Group activities involved
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Project (35%)
Progress meetings 5%
Oral presentation 20%
Final Report 10%
- Technical content (7%)
- Clarity and English (3%)

Final (35%)
Assignment (20%)
– Assignment 1 on EF 10%
– Assignment 2 on News Journal 10%

Class/lab participation (include special
guest lecture + field trip) (10%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy
Group project takes much time
Journal is tedious.
Every week in October needa submit 2 journal: total 8

reviews.author: kwycas
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 - 3
Foundations of Environmental Science
(Chapters 1 to 4)
Major Environmental Issues and Search for the Solutions
Week 4 - 7
Environmental Issues
- Population (Ch. 6)
- Food (Ch. 7)
- Biodiversity and Conservation (Ch. 8)
Week 8 - 12
- Noise Fundamentals
- Water Resource and Pollution (Ch. 12) - Air Pollution (Ch. 13)
- Waste Management Overview (Ch. 17)
Week 13
- Project Presentation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interactive teaching style
Averagely 60-70 pages of slides
Professor mentioned the main points during classes, should pay more attention to that
reviews.comment_grading:
• Course Project (35%)
• Final (35%)
• Assignment (20%)
– Assignment 1 on EF 10%
– Assignment 2 on News Journal 10%
• Class/lab participation (include special guest lecture + field trip) (10%)

reviews.author: JY_XueBa_Not
reviews.title: Project-Based Learning
reviews.comment_content:
The content is really simple as named as the fundamentals of science.

This includes Air quality, Pollution, Biodiversity, Evolution and more.
It is really easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lau is really enthusiastic about the environmental topics. One tip, raise question whenever you dont understand, try engage more in class or else you might be left out.
reviews.comment_grading:
Prof. Lau is pretty lenient with the grading, typical mean is B / B-

This course involves newspaper reporting , EF reporting, a group project and a final exam (MC, SQ, LQ)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload might be the greatest concern of all, as the group project last for 2 months and requires quite a bit of attention, though i enjoyed every part of it =)
